st:Description.name: AssemblyConstraints
st:Description.st:role: Setting to manage Assembly Design (Contraints) options
st:Description.st:detailedRole: Assembly Design (Constraints) setting contains all options necessary to Assembly Design(Constraints) commands

st:attribute.Name: DetectedMode
st:attribute.st:detailedRole: This attribute is used by commands such as Quick Constraint, which create the most accurate constraint from the context. The priority order may be determined by a predefined list or by the constraints solver

st:default.st:role: By default constraint is created according to the specified order

st:attribute.Name: QuickConstraintOrderedList
st:attribute.st:role: Constraints ordered list for Quick constraints creation
st:attribute.st:detailedRole: This attribute is the ordered list, used by commands such as Quick Constraint, and specifies the constraint creation priority. Note that this array of 6 values must not contain any duplicates

st:attribute.Name: RedundantModeSet
st:attribute.st:detailedRole: This attribute is used to control redundancy check when constraint is created

st:attribute.Name: CreateWithPublish
st:attribute.st:detailedRole: According to this attribute's value, constraints can be created on any geometry or only on published geometry

st:enum.st:role: The constraint can be created on any kind of geometry
The constraint can only be created on geometry published on the direct child level
The constraint can only be created on geometry published on any assembly level

st:default.st:role: By default constraint can be created on any geometry

st:attribute.Name: ReconnectCstOnCCP
st:attribute.st:role: Reconnect constraints on cut/copy paste mode.
st:attribute.st:detailedRole: This attribute determines the conditions under which constraints is copied and pasted.

st:enum.st:role: Constraints are not copied and pasted
Constraints are copied and pasted only after a Copy
Constraints are copied and pasted only after a Cut
Constraints are always copied and pasted

st:default.st:role: By default constraints are never copied and pasted
